channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Medicaid is crucially important to older Americans, but can it handle a rapidly aging population?
item.description: Needs may be unmet or larger burdens may fall to families

item.title: She Signed a Living Will. Her Sister Didn't Honor It.
item.description: A court ruling bolsters a key estate-planning move—and shows where it can fall short.

item.title: Invest in Banking Like Warren Buffett: Own a 'Castle'
item.description: Among Berkshire Hathaway’s largest holdings is a financial information-services company. The sector’s results speak for themselves.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Post Weekly, Monthly Gains
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures rose with colder temperature forecasts boosting the near-term demand outlook.

item.title: Gig work and startups aren’t the secret to your job success anymore. This is.
item.description: Keep small business owners on a profitable path with expanded tax breaks and affordable loans.

item.title: ‘His divorce lawyer was completely useless’: My husband is on the mortgage of his ex-wife’s house. She’s behind on the loan. What can we do?
item.description: ‘If he contacts the bank and asks to remove his name from the mortgage because he has no legal responsibility, will they force her to refinance?’

item.title: I’m 12 years from retirement, the future looks like a ‘train wreck’ and I want out of the market. Should I sell?
item.description: Don’t ignore your feelings, don’t do anything rash, and take these three pieces of advice

item.title: Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk's Obesity Moat Just Got Stronger
item.description: Data from their most serious competitor, Amgen, suggests the biotech won’t upstage the market leaders.

item.title: The Score: GM, Macy's, Novo Nordisk and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s 5 estate-planning tips are just as valuable as his investing advice
item.description: If you think he’s smart about money, wait until you hear what he has to say about wills
